intro: Tibouchina gardneri, commonly known as the velvetleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Tibouchina gardneri is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas.
